thread.title: Social life at Newcastle University ranked number one in the country

author: Kathryn Riddell
title: Social life at Newcastle University ranked number one in the country
text:

It will come as no surprise to students that Newcastle has been ranked number one for overall university experience. 
Newcastle University clinched the top spot for best overall university experience on a university comparison website and was also judged the best for social life. 
The website, University Compare, bases its rankings on four key elements of university life: institute and course, accommodation, employment prospects and social life. 
With each university given a maximum five star rating, Newcastle came top for ‘overall student experience’ with an average of 4.36/5. In second place was Nottingham Trent (4.35), while its Midlands counterpart, Loughborough came in third (4.34). Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
The top 10 best universities in the UK for overall student experience are: 
Newcastle University (4.36/5) 
University of Nottingham (4.22) 
University of Bristol (4.20) 
The rankings were based on data from almost 10,000 current and recently graduated university students across 425 institutions throughout the UK in the last 12 months. 
Newcastle was also rated as the number one university for social life ahead of Leeds, Nottingham Trent and Liverpool. 
The university just missed out on getting into the top 10 for accommodation (placed 11th) and for future employment prospects (placed 12th). Read More Universities ask Government to help stop a Brexit brain drain happening 
Despite coming out top overall, Newcastle was only 22nd best rated when it came to looking specifically at institute and course quality. 
In fact, it was Scottish universities that performed best here with St. Andrews (4.64), Dundee University (4.52) and The University of Stirling (4.52) in the top five alone. The Open University (4.55) and Nottingham Trent University (4.55) also fared well. 
“The life of today’s student goes far beyond the lecture hall”, said Owen O’Neill, founder of University Compare. 
“Prospective students must ensure they choose the city and university that is right for them. Not just academically, but socially, geographically and culturally. All of these factors have a telling influence on a student’s ability to settle in, perform well in the classroom and ultimately enjoy their experience.” Read More 
University Compare uses the Trip Advisor model, inviting written reviews to help prospective students identify the right university and course based on genuine reviews from current and recently graduated students. All reviews are individually vetted for authenticity.
